result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael John Karlik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the followinng by the end of supervisoin. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  as a condition of this case 15CF2321 and 17CF1539, restitution is to be paid as it relates to 15CM2824 at a total amount of $684.00 made payable to Mary W.
All court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
All court costs, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligation from the defenant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
**the restitution amount of $684.00/assessment was entered on 17CF1539.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Concurrent with count two.  Credit of 45 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment.  Obtain GED.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Follow all rules of supervision.
Follow through with any other treatment and programming deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and  also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one. Consecutive to any other sentence.  Straight time  Credit of 45 days.

records.addlTxt:
Count one.
Case closed without file.
Count two.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  24 MONTHS with 45 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, CONCURRENT to count 2; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, STRAIGHT TIME, with 45 days credit CONCURRENT to count 1, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentences. 

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment.
-Obtain GED. 
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment and programming deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
As a condition of this case (15CF2321) and 17CF1539, restitution is to be paid as it relates to 15CM2824 at a total amount of $684.00 made payable to Mary W. 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Michael John Karlik in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Michael John Karlik in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2: Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.



Case proceeded to sentencing.

Attorney James Robert Daniel Rael in court, defendant Michael John Karlik not in court, in custody.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Plea and Sentencing. Court is advised that State has not complied with victim notification for global resolution. Court ordered matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael John Karlik in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Michael John Karlik in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  As to count 2, defendant pleads NOT GUILTY.   DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.    Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
